alert.note: Alert for Durham; Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 27 at 9:54AM EDT until May 27 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Durham County in central North Carolina... Southeastern Orange County in central North Carolina... * Until noon EDT. * At 954 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the Chapel Hill and Durham. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Durham, Chapel Hill, Carrboro, Bethesda, Parkwood, Eno River State Park, Gorman, Jordan Lake and Falls Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
